result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel T. Kramer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Walworth County Clerk of Circuit Court
Walworth County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Defendant will not request early termination of probation.

miscConds.notes:
**NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
COC COLLECT

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent. 
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
No medication without valid prescription. No alcohol. No drugs or drug paraphernalia. No operation of motor vehicle without a valid license.

timeConds.notes:
to commence forthwith and with work release privileges.

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence. 

Defendant shall report to the jail on time and with no detectable amount of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription, or defendant will forfeit Huber/work release for a period of 5 days, unless reinstated by the court.
Complete 50 hours of community service work for each year of probation for a total of 100 hours without buyout option.

records.addlTxt:
2:01 PM (64-06) Defendant Daniel T. Kramer appeared by video.  Attorney Jeramiah Maynard in court for Daniel T. Kramer.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. 
ADA Herrmann called to the stand as a witness Aaron Greetham from the City of Lake Geneva Police Dept.
Witness has identified defendant on the video. Exhibit #1 marked, identified and discussed.
2:02PM - Cross examination by Attorney Maynard. Exhibit #1 discussed.
2:05PM - Evidence is closed.
Argument by ADA Herrmann. 
Defense declines argument at this time. 
Attorney Maynard has previously reviewed complaint with client.
Plead not guilty to all charges on behalf of his client.
Speedy Trial Reserved.

Adj. 2:07PM

Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Daniel T. Kramer in court, in custody by video.  Attorney jeramiah maynard in court for Daniel T. Kramer. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Reading of complaint waived. Rights given and preliminary hearing requested, within time period. Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Daniel T. Kramer in court, in custody by video. Attorney Jason Daane for defendant. records.addlTxt: Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH DOLLAR TREE IN LAKE GENEVA, WI. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Daniel T Kramer in court, in custody by video. JJ Crawford appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Mackenzie Renner appeared for bond purposes only. Defendant referred to SPD. Defendant out on bond in Waukesha Co. Has lengthy criminal history, on PO hold.  Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
